definition: exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general

sentences.english: However, satisfaction also appears to be influenced by psychologic factors.
sentences.chinese: 然而，满意程度似乎也是整个身体的影响因素之一。

sentences.english: Who make you mushroom so late, the whole ruddy blood temple you this hour equitable obtain up.
sentences.chinese: 谁让你起得这么晚，整个赤血宫就你这个时辰才起床。

sentences.english: Once Synechococcus spp. forms bloom, its influence will be far-reaching to whole ecosystem.
sentences.chinese: 一旦形成赤潮，对整个生态系统的影响将非常深远。

sentences.english: All summer, my goal HAS BEEN to catch a firefly. ---How do you translate HAS BEEN?
sentences.chinese: 整个夏天，我的目的就是捉到一只荧火虫。

sentences.english: The whole shebang smells sort of fishy to me.
sentences.chinese: 整个事情使我觉得有点蹊跷。

sentences.english: That is the entire stalker problem right there.
sentences.chinese: 这才是整个跟踪狂问题的症结所在。

sentences.english: I've spent my entire adult life doing battle with this idea.
sentences.chinese: 整个成年生活我都在和这个想法作斗争。

sentences.english: The popular PE is the major part of the whole career of PE.
sentences.chinese: 群众体育是构成整个体育事业的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: Crystal base, foil glittering and translucent get rid of whole product extremely smart showily.
sentences.chinese: 水晶底座晶莹剔透，烘托整个产品极其醒目华贵。

sentences.english: He killed off the whole morning by listening to the music.
sentences.chinese: 他通过听音乐消磨掉了整个上午的时光。

sentences.english: Want to manure the whole place over, scabby soil.
sentences.chinese: 这片土壤太贫瘠了，想整个儿施一通肥。

sentences.english: Across the industry, occupancy rates have dropped about 10 percent Carew said.
sentences.chinese: 整个行业，住房率已下降10%左右，卡鲁说。

sentences.english: The earth was as completely cloud-shrouded as normally is the planet Venus.
sentences.chinese: 整个地球就像金星平时那样完全被云雾掩盖着。

sentences.english: It was Guri who killed the entire board of directors for the rival Ororo Transportation.
sentences.chinese: 是古丽清洗了竞争对手奥罗罗运输公司的整个董事会。

sentences.english: Who could have predicted that within ten years hed be in charge of the whole company?
sentences.chinese: 谁曾能预料到在十年内他会成为整个公司的负责人？

sentences.english: They decided that the entire game would have to be replayed.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定整个比赛要重新再赛一次。

definition: whole entity/entire body/synthesis/as a whole (situation, construction, team etc)/global/macrocosm/integral/holistic/whole
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
and even/to go so far as to
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
to run through/a connecting thread from beginning to end/to link
to stand up/to get up/also pr. [qi3 lai2]

(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state/indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站[zhan4])/indicating completion/(after a perception verb, e.g. 看[kan4]) expressing preliminary judgment/also pr. [qi3 lai5]
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
